Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Regarding the above discussed Censorship-resistant decentralised file streaming chain, would it also be better to make only txns submitted by specific pubkeys as valid? -- > This is so that spam can't bloat the chain unnecessarily and hinder the legit transactions.
So only the streamer(and notaries) can submit transactions and others can just host nodes to support the resilience of the network

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
project called ascii_camera for video only no audio, and it grabs each frame, which i've just dumped into `console.log` to test i can grab frames.
original src forked on github.
being webcam, it makes me think of audio and syncing....so this is where intercepting webrtc streams (which are already mixed) would be easier and chunkify rather than frame-by-frame video, for a workable solution.   at least getting media through browser is demonstratable if we need to at least try with "dynamic" content

clone that and browse on your local machine - i added `console.log(asciiCharacters);` to line 51 of ascii.js  https://github.com/imylomylo/ascii-camera/blob/master/script/ascii.js#L51

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: that's just me waving at the webcam, performance on my laptop was a little sluggish with other things open.

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: dude that is some next level crypto hacker shit. looks awesome @Mylo !

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: nah that's some other person's work, i just find it and bend it into something we can use for testing inbetween a proper solution 😃

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
better one.   captured and synced audio+video, captured in 10ms chunks - some blobs are under 8kB some are over, so may need to tune it to 5ms chunks.
Format is webm at capture source, possibly able to just re-assemble in a web container and hit play - not sure about as a streaming src on re-assemble.  something to look into if needed but at least we have synced A/V!!!

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: either way, can still chunkify it to fit.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
here at line 76 i added `console.log("CAPTURED A BLOB! BYTE SIZE: " + event.data.size )`  https://github.com/webrtc/samples/blob/gh-pages/src/content/getusermedia/record/js/main.js#L76
Try it yourself!

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
ac_name=STREAMED. Ticker STREAM. 
For, literal, on chain audio/video streaming services.

STREAMED
Cambridge Dictionary defintion:
`past simple and past participle of stream`

Urban Dictionary definition:
`Music or video that is being being played via the internet on either a Computer, Phone or TV.`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yeah the PoC went well, but it cna be imporved no end ... I think really the chain creator needs total centralised control over what is put onto the chain... So likely they should be the only miner, and also the only one who can make transactions. This prevents someone spamming their chain, when trying to stream with it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The whole point of this, is to get data into a blockchain that has been dPoW'ed to KMD - > BTC so that the source can always be verified as correct and not altered.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Well thats the way I see it ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Guess too, if someone wants to stream video and keeps gettig banned from a centralised service.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I would have taught there would be alterniatives without a blockchain for that already though 🤔

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Can you limit who accesses your stream through pubkey?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: or have limitations to open it or limit it as much as you want

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That seems a LOT harder to solve.... but the stream cna be encrypted...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so the encrypted stream in on  public blockchain... but without the right keys to decrypt it you cant see what it is.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its not like notary nods would keep these chains running for an extended time after the stream happened.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as these chains grow in size very fast, for a 470MB file sent, I had 40MB approx of overhead, which is really not bad.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but over a few hours, the data would really add up

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Would that be stored on the mining machine only though?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So you could have a dapp that hosts the chain for you

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: and once the stream is complete, the dapp can store elsewhere (if you want to access it again) or delete it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no not really ... the streamer would start the chain, and them stream and mine it ... hopefully to enough nodes, then all those nodes watching it would receive a copy.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: while it was being watched, the dApp could save a local copy not in the blockchain, but like I said before, keeping the raw blockchain, to be able to verify it against KMD later is the real thing that sets this apart from other forms of streaming.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to be noted, any data and be streamed into the blockchain, with what I tested yesterday.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not just video.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: why would one need to verify it against kmd?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to prove the copy was the exact same and unaltered

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: any normal video file cna be edited

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this simply cant, if you ahev the blockchain raw copy.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: resync it from youself with KMD running and check every notarisation TX against KMD ... it they all match ... then the source is genuine.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: blockchains make things immutable, thats the whole point of them no ?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So if it wasn't verified, any of the people who received the data could manipulate the blockchain data, in turn 'editing' the video for example

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if it didnt ahve dPoW then anyone could just manipulate the raw data.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but with dPoW, there is checkpoint in the chain every 5 blocks (at least on staked, we might even try faster than this again later on, evey 3 seems possible)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this checkpoint contains the TXID of a transaction on KMD ... which contains the blockchash and a MoM

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That MoM and blockhash allows you to erify the chain was the same as when it was notarised to KMD.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if its been altered, then the hashes wont match up

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or the chain sould simplly be corrupted and not sync.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Thanks for the explanation. Still trying to wrap my head around the whole concept and uses that can come from it 😛

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: No body knows what usecases will come from it...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I didnt even think somehting like this was possible only a few days ago

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The possibilities it opens up are pretty broad.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I think that's where my brain is getting caught in a loop. Trying to solve that thought aha

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Isn't it just data verification secured by dPoW?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
In the case we are talking about, it is via a streaming process.
My understanding was that the difference to conventional video streaming services was that you could pay to have your own blockchain to host the video yourself. The only rules on that chain are whatever you decide to set. Nobody has the ability to stop it other than you (the miner).

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes... that also... but if some authority really wanted to stop you ... they woul djust switch off the internet the stream was comming from.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Indeed so

Content: stops orphans

Content: Its for 1 person solely to push data to a chain and have it notarized

Content: seems 0 reason to allow eveyrone to mine it...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as that will mostly just enable anyone to break it.
